description:
Launch a Docker container as a task.

If a Docker server is available (either locally or via environment variables
such as "DOCKER_HOST"), then it will be used to start the container.
name: docker

optionalFields.Synopsis: A 'source:destination' list of folders to mount onto the container from the host.
optionalFields.Summary: A list of folders to mount onto the container from the host. The expected format for each string entry in the list is `source:destination`. So for example: `binds: ["host_folder/scripts:/scripts"]`

optionalFields.Synopsis: A map of key/value pairs to label the docker container with.
optionalFields.Summary: A map of key/value pair(s), stored in docker as a string. Each key/value pair must be unique. Validiation occurs at the docker layer, not in Waypoint. Label keys are alphanumeric strings which may contain periods (.) and hyphens (-).

optionalFields.Synopsis: A list of strings with network names to connect the container to.
optionalFields.Summary: A list of networks to connect the container to. By default the container will always connect to the `waypoint` network.

optionalFields.Synopsis: The resources that the tasks should use.

SubFields.Synopsis: The cpu shares that the tasks should use
The amount of memory to use. Defined as '512MB', '44kB', etc.

optionalFields.Synopsis: environment variables to expose to the application
optionalFields.Summary: These variables are used to control all of a container's modes, such as configuring it to start a web app vs a background worker. These environment variables should not be common configuration variables normally set in `waypoint config`.

outputAttrsHelp: Output attributes can be used in your `waypoint.hcl` as [variables](/docs/waypoint-hcl/variables) via [`artifact`](/docs/waypoint-hcl/variables/artifact) or [`deploy`](/docs/waypoint-hcl/variables/deploy).
